input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: OLD AGE INSURANCE FUND FOR PHARMACISTS. Summary: Implementation of an it Solution for Energy Management and Monitoring of Tertiary Real Estate Assets of the Pharmacists' Old Age Insurance Fund (Cavp). Description: The purpose of this contract is to set up an IT solution for managing and monitoring the energy consumption of CAVP's tertiary assets. In its sustainable development approach, the CAVP has set several objectives to achieve such as reducing the energy consumption of its tertiary assets by 40% by 2030, to meet the requirements of the tertiary decree: - Improve the management of its energy performance and optimize energy-related costs via automatic detection of anomalies on buildings; - Ensure the completeness and reliability of the data to supply regulatory and internal reporting; - The reduction of its carbon footprint by 2030. The market is a single-award framework agreement, with no minimum and a maximum amount of 300,000 euros excluding tax over its entire duration of execution Implementation of an IT solution for energy management and monitoring of the tertiary real estate assets of the Insurance Fund old age of pharmacists (CAVP) The purpose of this contract is to set up an IT solution for managing and monitoring the energy consumption of CAVP's tertiary assets. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SYCTOM, THE METROPOLITAN HOUSEHOLD WASTE AGENCY. Summary: Development of a Tool Based on Data Analysis to Anticipate Mercury Peaks in the Chimney over the Uve Isseane.. Description: The object of the contract is the development of a tool based on data analysis in order to anticipate mercury peaks in chimneys on the Isséane pilot UVE. The requested service includes the analysis of data to develop the model, the development of the model, tests to guarantee the reliability of the model, deployment of the model on site, team training and maintenance operations. The services are broken down into three technical parts as follows: Technical part n°1 Development of a prediction model on the Isséane site. •Technical part n°2 Integration of the model's executable program into the control-command system (SNCC) of the Isséane site. •Technical part n°3 Maintenance and remote maintenance of the program for running the model. DEVELOPMENT OF A TOOL BASED ON DATA ANALYSIS TO ANTICIPATE MERCURY PEAKS IN THE CHIMNEY OVER THE UVE ISSEANE. Doc Title: DEVELOPMENT OF A TOOL BASED ON DATA ANALYSIS TO ANTICIPATE MERCURY PEAKS BY CHIMNEY ON THE UVE ISSEANE. Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: SYCTOM, THE METROPOLITAN HOUSEHOLD WASTE AGENCY
output.Summary: Development of a Tool Based on Data Analysis to Anticipate Mercury Peaks in the Chimney over the Uve Isseane.
output.Description: The object of the contract is the development of a tool based on data analysis in order to anticipate mercury peaks in chimneys on the Isséane pilot UVE. The requested service includes the analysis of data to develop the model, the development of the model, tests to guarantee the reliability of the model, deployment of the model on site, team training and maintenance operations. The services are broken down into three technical parts as follows: Technical part n°1 Development of a prediction model on the Isséane site. •Technical part n°2 Integration of the model's executable program into the control-command system (SNCC) of the Isséane site. •Technical part n°3 Maintenance and remote maintenance of the program for running the model. DEVELOPMENT OF A TOOL BASED ON DATA ANALYSIS TO ANTICIPATE MERCURY PEAKS IN THE CHIMNEY OVER THE UVE ISSEANE. Doc Title: DEVELOPMENT OF A TOOL BASED ON DATA ANALYSIS TO ANTICIPATE MERCURY PEAKS BY CHIMNEY ON THE UVE ISSEANE. Contract Type: services

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CTÉ CNES LA DOMITIENNE. Summary: Supply, Service and Maintenance of the Information System Infrastructure and an Outsourced Messaging Solution. Description: The main IS infrastructure of the La Domitienne community is hosted at the headquarters. It is based on an architecture based on 1 physical server hosting virtual machines and a NAS for backup. Some remote sites have also local infrastructure. The server infrastructure in place at headquarters is reaching the end of its life and no longer meets the requirements of the La Domitienne community in terms of performance and security. In this context, the Community of La Domitienne commune wishes to renew its headquarters server infrastructure in order to meet its current and future challenges. The purpose of this framework agreement is therefore: - The supply of equipment and software allowing the implementation of the architecture server - Migration of existing data and applications (VM) to the new architecture - Provision of an outsourced messaging solution (antispam) - Provision of a supervision and administration solution - All services specification and physical and logical integration allowing the implementation of the target solution - Preventive, corrective and evolutionary maintenance of hardware and software implemented as part of the consultation Supply, service and maintenance of the Information System infrastructure and an outsourced messaging solution Doc Title: Supply, service and maintenance of the Information System infrastructure and a.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: HUS-GHT 10 SUPPORT ESTABLISHMENT. Summary: Acquisition and Deployment of Four-Module Software - Perioperative Medicine for the University Hospitals of Strasbourg. Description: The framework agreement will be executed by issuing purchase orders. The services are regulated by unit and fixed prices. The estimated amounts are indicative and include all renewal periods. The market is made for the account of the HUS. The FHU DATA-SURGE aims to improve care before, during and after surgical operations by applying new data science techniques to their richest data aggregates, as generated by the latest generations of electronic medical records and connected monitoring devices. The aim of this scientific approach is to analyze the large quantities of data collected during surgical interventions in order to improve our knowledge of the state of health of operated patients. Clinical applications sought include optimizing care for surgical patients. These optimizations could make it possible to improve the state of health after an operation, to make the experience hospital experience more pleasant, and to make the entire healthcare system more efficient. The FHU brings together the expertise of doctors, researchers, computer scientists and data security specialists and patient representatives who are essential to these goals. It emphasizes collaboration between clinicians, biostatisticians and machine learning researchers to maximize the potential of health data. The project includes initiatives.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SYTRAL MOBILITÉS - TRANSPORT. Summary: Services for Providing Attendance Forecast Models and Revenues. Description: SYTRAL Mobilités implemented the unified network on September 1, 2025, bringing together the TCL, Cars du Rhône and Libellule networks in order to offer a seamless vision to travelers across its entire perimeter. This unified network is accompanied by: - ​​A unified zonal pricing over the entire perimeter, - A new hierarchy of the lines of the 3 historic networks in 1 - A single ticketing system - Unified passenger information tools - A unified operating regulation - A single brand (TCL). Unified zonal pricing and the unification of ticketing and ticket distribution throughout the SYTRAL Mobilités territory have changed revenue monitoring. The challenge for SYTRAL Mobilités is to have tools for forecasting multi-factor and multi-scale recipes adapted to the new unified pricing. Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CIVILIAN. Summary: Relaunch of Lot N°5 of the Cybersecurity Services and Tools Market: Identity Management Software in Active Directory and Bastion Software. Description: The purpose of this contract is to implement Cybersecurity services and solutions: - Lot n°1: Identity management software in Active Directory? - Lot n°2: Bastion software. This concerns the relaunch of lot no. 5 of the services market and of cybersecurity tools, following an unsuccessful attempt. CIVIS wishes to implement an identity and access management (IAM) solution offering multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Active Directory, single sign-on (SSO), Contextual access controls and simple and efficient session management. The solution must be a SAAS solution in CAPEX mode in advance over 3 years. It should make it possible to organize the governance of the security of the CIVIS IS by a combination of processes ensured and executed by the governing body. It must enable the management of risks which could prevent the achievement of the objectives of CIVIS. Finally, it must enable the management of compliance of policies, procedures, laws and regulations of the CIVIS (NIS2). CIVIS wishes to set up a Bastion d'administration or PAM (Privileged Access Management) solution certified by ANSSI, to supervise, control, trace and protect its network and its servers from access to privileges. Doc Title: Relaunch of lot n°5 of the cybersecurity services and tools market: Identity management software in Active Directory and Bastion Software Contract Type: supplies. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: INTERDEPARTMENTAL UNION FOR SANITATION IN THE PARIS METROPOLITAN AREA (SIAAP). Summary: Collaborative Work Missions Around the Bim Process. Description: BIM Process Framework Agreement (BIM Project Management Assistance (AMO) lots, Digitization Lot and Modeling Lot). This framework agreement covers a set of intellectual services linked to the BIM process, applicable to all sites. Faced with technological developments, SIAAP wishes to rely on this contractual support to support its design and construction projects, as well as to ensure optimized management of its assets. It is structured into 3 lots: - Lots (Support Project Management (AMO) BIM, Digitization Lot and Modeling Lot) are framework agreements with multi-awarder purchase orders. The distribution of services by lot is as follows: * Project Management Assistance (AMO) BIM Lot Two types of missions are expected: 1- Support the project owner in the management of the project in the design and execution phases, from a BIM perspective 2- Support from management for structuring documents related to BIM, outside of specific projects. * Digitization Batch The purpose of this lot is to provide digitalization services, in particular the acquisition of point clouds (aerial, terrestrial, networks), with a view to modeling or analyzing assets. * Batch Modeling This lot allows the creation of 3D digital models integrating data from various sources (paper plans, CAD files, point clouds). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GRAND EST REGION. Summary: Supply and Installation of Multimedia Equipment for Educational Establishments in the Grand Est Region, the European Community of Alsace and the Meuse Department as Well as for The.... Description: Supply and installation of multimedia equipment for educational establishments in the Grand Est Region, the European Community of Alsace and the Meuse department as well as for the... The market subject of the consultation aims at the acquisition and the installation of multimedia equipment for public high schools in the Grand Est Region and public middle schools in the European Community of Alsace (CeA) and the Meuse Department, i.e. 406 educational establishments as well as for the needs of internal services of the Grand Est Region. In this context, the Region, the CeA and the Meuse department have come together in a group of orders of which the Grand Est Region is the coordinator. The contract aims at the acquisition and (possible) installation multimedia equipment: video projectors and screens, printers, viewers, speakers, accessories and software licenses... as well as training. Furthermore, subsequent contracts may be concluded to meet any new needs, particularly in the context of the implementation of systems linked to hybridization* and materials and accessories for calls for academic projects around Nomad TVs and video capture. To keep the stock of educational establishments up to date, the Grand Est Region replaces around 900 aging equipment per year; the CeA replaces around 200 to 500 aging pieces of equipment per year, and the Meuse Department replaces (since 2023) its entire video projector fleet (around 500), at the speed of approximately 100 video projectors per year (this replacement program is expected to end in December 2027). The contract will be concluded in the form of an agreement.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Credit Cards for the Supply of Fuel, for Recharging Electric - Hybrid Vehicles and Associated Services (Washes, Ad-Blue) for Vehicles in the Department of Gard. Description: The multi-awardee framework agreement will be executed by issuing purchase orders. The conditions for awarding purchase orders are detailed in the CCP. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GIP FRANCE PROTECTED CHILDREN. Summary: Supply, Implementation, Maintenance and Operation of an it Solution for Archiving Data from the Lisa Application. Description: The purpose of this consultation is to acquire a solution allowing the archiving of data contained in the LISA application. LISA is the SNATED-119 business application used by SNATED teams to manage calls (telephone calls, chats and forms), draw up a report of the situations and, depending on the situation, transmit it to the departments for evaluation and local treatment of the situation. The consultation also concerns the recovery of data existing assets as well as the maintenance of this solution, which must be able to adapt to developments in the LISA application. The consultation will give rise to a single-award framework agreement with a fixed part concerning the supply of the software specific and a part with purchase orders concerning maintenance (application and scalable). The procedure is concluded without a minimum amount but with a maximum amount of: 221,000 euros excluding tax for all periods combined. The market provides for a duration linked to development, in particular the recovery of data, and the implementation of the software, then a duration linked to the maintenance of the software. The duration of market development will be proposed by the holder in its offer. Then the maintenance part with purchase orders will be notified for a period of 12 months, renewable a maximum of 3 times. This consultation is not the subject of an allotment.. Published Date: 2025-12-20. Closing Date: 2026-01-29. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Supply, Implementation, Maintenance and Operation of an it Solution for Archiving Data from the Lisa Application
output.Description: The purpose of this consultation is to acquire a solution allowing the archiving of data contained in the LISA application. LISA is the SNATED-119 business application used by SNATED teams to manage calls (telephone calls, chats and forms), draw up a report of the situations and, depending on the situation, transmit it to the departments for evaluation and local treatment of the situation. The consultation also concerns the recovery of data existing assets as well as the maintenance of this solution, which must be able to adapt to developments in the LISA application. The consultation will give rise to a single-award framework agreement with a fixed part concerning the supply of the software specific and a part with purchase orders concerning maintenance (application and scalable). The procedure is concluded without a minimum amount but with a maximum amount of: 221,000 euros excluding tax for all periods combined. The market provides for a duration linked to development, in particular the recovery of data, and the implementation of the software, then a duration linked to the maintenance of the software. The duration of market development will be proposed by the holder in its offer. The solution must comply with digital accessibility obligations, and responsible design of digital services in accordance with the RGAA (General Framework for Improvement of Accessibility). The solution must also comply with the La Poste Group (PSSIG) security policy. The consultation file that will be sent to the selected service providers will specify the elements linked to this requirement. The consultation consists of a single lot. The market brings together the needs of Toulouse Métropole, the City of Toulouse, the Municipality of Balma, the Municipality of Blagnac, the Municipality of Brax, the Municipality of Bruguières, the COSAT (Social Work Committee Sport Agents Toulouse), the Municipality of Cugnaux, the Public Establishment of Capitole, the Municipality of Flourens, the Municipality of Union, the Municipality of Mondonvile, the Municipality of Pibrac, the Municipality of Saint-Alban and of the Municipality of Saint-Orens. The framework agreement is neither allocated nor broken down into tranches optional. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: LOIRE ATLANTIC DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: Establishment of a Public Service Concession Relating to the Operation of the Tele-Assistance Service. Description: As part of this policy of home support for elderly people and/or people with disabilities, the Department has offered since 2006 a departmental teleassistance system 7 days a week, 24 hours a day, making it possible to combat isolation in providing assistance and comfort at home, and improving the daily living conditions and safety of beneficiaries. The technical implementation of this service (installation, maintenance and call management) is entrusted to a private operator in as part of a public service concession since 2021. The concessionaire ensures the operational, administrative and financial management of the system. The Department has chosen to renew the public service concession contract at the end of 31 December 2026, for a period of 5 years. The management of the public service will be carried out at the expense and risk of the concessionaire, who will be substantially remunerated from the marketing of services to users. The dealer is expected to continue and develop the departmental teleassistance system in favor of an offer accessible to the greatest number of people, technically scalable but also guaranteeing reinforced social listening, particularly for the most vulnerable. The management of this The device involves: Installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of remote assistance equipment at subscribers' homes Administrative and financial management of subscriptions Management of calls in person.... Published Date: 2025-12-17. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: THE POST OFFICE. Summary: Supply and Integration of a Data Extraction, Transformation and Loading Solution and Associated Services. Description: The IT Services Department (i-TEAM Department) of La Poste wishes to acquire a software solution for extracting, transforming and loading data in SaaS or Hybrid mode and associated services. The solution will be sent to La Poste and will cover firm services on the deployment of the solution and optional services, detailed below. The language of the proposed solution and services (support, training, etc.) must be in French. The exchanges are will be exclusively in French. The application must comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The processing of personal data of La Poste, including hosting, storage and/or consultation must must be located within the European Union (EU), a country in the European Economic Area (EEA), or a country recognized as suitable by the European Union. The solution must comply with digital accessibility obligations, and responsible design of digital services in accordance with the RGAA (General Framework for Improvement of Accessibility). The solution must also comply with the La Poste Group (PSSIG) security policy. The consultation file that will be sent to the selected service providers will specify the elements linked to this requirement. The consultation consists of a single lot. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ENEDIS SA. Summary: Collaborative Design Tool. Description: This procedure presents the need for a SaaS collaborative design tool used for the design of user interfaces (UI) and user experiences (UX) to enable teams to design, prototype and collaborate in real time on projects. digital product for business. This type of tool has been used at the Enedis IT department since January 2021 by a population of designers and developers but also at the Dircom DR and EDF group level. It is notably the central tool of the skills center Design By Enedis and the Source Design System project which aims to develop a scalable digital ecosystem and guarantee respect for the fundamental principles of UX design. This also involves the challenge of centralizing knowledge of digital products within the company, to inspect the quality of production, and to control project deviations wishing to do without the support of a design expert and avoid multiplying the tools for product design. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENT OF DORDOGNE. Summary: Supplies of Dematerialized Restaurant Tickets for Agents of the Dordogne Departmental Council. Description: The purpose of this contract is the supply, delivery and management of electronic meal vouchers for agents of the Dordogne Departmental Council (excluding family assistants and children's village agents). The service includes: - the supply and delivery of dematerialized restaurant vouchers. - the provision of an IT solution for managing restaurant voucher orders (WEB ordering tool). - access to a personal beneficiary account via an online platform secure and an application. It is concluded in the form of a framework agreement with purchase orders with a maximum quantity set at 1,497,200 restaurant vouchers per year. It lasts for one year and is renewable 3 times tacitly. A phase is planned preparatory prior to the implementation of the service. This preparatory phase will begin upon notification of the framework agreement. During this phase, lasting a maximum of 8 weeks, the incumbent must: - Configure the command tool in line, - Configure the cards, - Place a test order (menu and restaurant vouchers) The first order must be able to be carried out in June 2026: loading of the cards in the month of June 2026 (working days in the month of May 2026) SUPPLIES OF DEMATERIALIZED RESTAURANT TICKETS FOR AGENTS OF THE DORDOGNE DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL The purpose of this contract is the supply, delivery and management of dematerialized restaurant vouchers for agents.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL COMPANY SNCF. Summary: N1 Piloting and Operations Service Center. Description: The purpose of this contract is to define the specific terms and conditions relating to the activities of SNCF Réseau, within the framework of which the Holder undertakes to provide, on the basis of a fixed-price commitment, IT and intellectual services. in accordance with the provisions of the N1 Piloting and Operations Service Center Contract and its Appendices. These services include: - Monitoring of production systems (monitoring of alerts and initial checks); - Execution of standard procedures for resolving recurring incidents; - Escalation to levels 2 or 3 in the event of an incident outside the N1 perimeter. The N1 Management and Operations Service Center Contract specifies the conditions of intervention of the Holder, who undertakes to carry out the above-mentioned services in accordance with the needs expressed by the Digital Department of SNCF Réseau (DGNUM). Doc Title: Piloting and Operations Service Center N1 Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-16. Closing Date: 2026-01-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Framework Agreement for Infrastructure Project Management, Accessibility Studies and Traffic Studies (Road Flow Counts and Active Modes, Floating Car Data and Traffic Modeling). Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is infrastructure project management, accessibility studies and traffic studies (counting, floating car data and traffic modeling). This framework agreement concerns project management missions, such as as defined in articles R. 243-1 et seq. and in appendix 20 of the Public Procurement Code (decree of March 22, 2019), as well as accessibility study and traffic study missions (counting, floating car data and traffic modeling) Lot n°1 -Project management missions for mobility infrastructure projects This lot concerns support for the study and project management with a view to creating developments and infrastructures for sustainable mobility, for which the Savoie Mont-Blanc Ecomobility Agency is Assistant to the Project Owner. The Project Owner will be one of the shareholder communities of the SPL Agence Ecomobilité Savoie Mont-Blanc. The developments will mainly be cycle facilities (path cycle path, green lane), road developments allowing easier insertion of the cycle (road with unmarked central lane, zone 30, cycle lanes, etc.), pedestrian developments (meeting zone, sidewalk), carpooling arrangements (drop-off), crossing structures (pedestrian/cycle tunnels, footbridges). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: HAUTE-VIENNE DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: Operation and Maintenance of the Departmental Directional Signage Database and Staking Studies. Description: Direction signage is established in a department in accordance with a departmental master plan, which is based on the national master plan approved by the State for major links known as “green links”. In Haute-Vienne, there is a departmental master plan, updated in 2008 by the Departmental Assembly. The missions relating to this consultation consist of updating the departmental directional signage database with the modifications made by the department of Haute-Vienne, by checking conformity, compliance with the regulations in force, the consistency of the elements and information as a whole, and others. The service provider may also be required to carry out specific studies itself, the request of the public buyer, such as for example, the creation of a diversion or a road cycling zone.. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL CENTER FOR SPACE STUDIES. Summary: Integration of a Monitoring, Management and Control System for the Energy Distribution Network at the Guiana Space Center. Description: This contract concerns the project to implement a monitoring, management and control system for the energy distribution network of the Guyanese space center. It covers the technical scope of the services expected within the framework of the operational implementation of the Smart Grid system developed by the CEA for the CNES. The source code and its software have been specifically designed to meet the constraints of resilience, energy optimization and interoperability with the technical environment of the base. This phase aims to ensure deployment, configuration, functional integration with existing systems, and effective commissioning. This consultation is financed by funds from the European Space Agency and therefore complies with geographic return requirements as described in the consultation file. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: YVELINES DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: Innovation Partnership Relating to the Development of a Hardware and Software Solution Enabling Support for Users through Services Dedicated to Autonomy, Coordination Of.... Description: Innovation partnership relating to the development of a hardware and software solution enabling support for users through services dedicated to autonomy, coordination of... The contract is an innovation partnership, in application of article L. 2172-3 of the Public Procurement Code. Its purpose is the development of a hardware and software solution enabling the support of users through services dedicated to autonomy, coordination of professionals and giving access to a range of services. It also provides for the acquisition of associated services, necessary for the operation of the Solution, and optional. Details of the expected characteristics and functionalities appears in the Functional Expression of Need (FEB). The contract takes the form of a mixed price contract, broken down into 4 tranches (each corresponding to an innovative functionality that the AutonomY Agency wishes to see in the Solution), 1 firm tranche and 3 optional installments: - Firm tranche (TF): Remote assistance with secure personal data safe; - Optional section n°1 (TO1): Voice recognition and video telephony; - Optional phase no. 2 (TO2): Identification of weaknesses; - Optional section n°3 (TO3): Detection and management of distress situations. Each tranche is itself broken down into 3 successive phases: - Phase 1 Research: to study the Solution, including its innovative Features, and write the detailed external specifications thereof; - Phase 2 Development: for the design of the Solution and its experimentation with a test population; - Ph.... Published Date: 2025-12-11. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: NANTES METROPOLE. Summary: Implementation of a Counting Solution for the Arts Museum. Description: A counting system present at the various entrances and exits of the Museum of Arts was installed for the reopening of the museum in 2017. This is an automated counting system provided by the company 3D Counting. Several two-way 3D sensors were installed above 6 access doors to the museum. The counting data could be viewed on proprietary data visualization and processing software. The system was designed to ensure compliance with fire safety gauges in the building in accordance with fire safety regulations for Establishments Receiving Audience. This obligation has been recalled in the reports of the security commission since 2013 in the methods of calculating the number of members of the public that can be admitted: counting system installed so as to limit the number to less than 1,500 people for the entire site and to less than 300 people for the Oratory Chapel (in accordance with article Y2 §2) - provisions accepted by the Municipal Security Commission on 07/29/2013. Following the closure of the 3D Counting company in 2021, the Museum of Arts' automated counting system is now out of service. Therefore and in order to ensure its regulatory obligations in terms of safety gauge management, the Museum of Arts has implemented a degraded system based on manual counting, pending replacement of the automated counting system. This situation must no longer continue. Its replacement and ext.... Published Date: 2025-12-06. Closing Date: 2026-01-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

This obligation has been recalled in the reports of the security commission since 2013 in the methods of calculating the number of members of the public that can be admitted: counting system installed so as to limit the number to less than 1,500 people for the entire site and to less than 300 people for the Oratory Chapel (in accordance with article Y2 §2) - provisions accepted by the Municipal Security Commission on 07/29/2013. Following the closure of the 3D Counting company in 2021, the Museum of Arts' automated counting system is now out of service. Description: This consultation is part of a call for FEDER projects - Development of intelligent energy networks in the Hauts-de-France region. The project carried out by the Gazelec de Peronne company, a local public establishment of an industrial and commercial nature, aims to optimize the integration of renewable energies (solar, wind, biogas) and local resources to strengthen energy efficiency and territorial autonomy. The project also sets up an intelligent supervision system to monitor energy flows in real time, adjust the production to meet needs and anticipate fluctuations.

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: METROPOLE NICE COTE D'AZUR. Summary: Pre-Audit and Digital Accessibility Audit Service. Description: Provision of pre-audit and digital accessibility audit for the community's websites and internal applications (business software), as part of its digital accessibility policy. This approach is part of: • compliance with legal accessibility obligations (law of 11 February 2005, RGAA 4/5), • the implementation of the policy of inclusion and equal opportunities for all agents and users, • the reduction of the digital divide and inequalities of access to information and services linked to disability or particular situations (difficulties visual, auditory, motor or cognitive). The contract includes three types of services: 1. Pre-audit: rapid and summary diagnosis of accessibility. 2. Support and advice for developers: corrective action resulting from the pre-audit in preparation for the accessibility audit 3. Audit complete: exhaustive verification of compliance with the RGAA with corrective action plan. This consultation is launched following the adapted procedure procurement procedure (article R.2123-1. of the Public Procurement Code) This is a framework agreement with purchase orders for a duration of: 12 months (excluding renewals) Number of possible renewals: 2 Annual minimum: 10,000.00 Euros Annual maximum: 60,000.00 Euros Value in Euros excluding tax.. Published Date: 2025-11-22. Closing Date: 2025-12-18. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: As part of this policy of home support for elderly people and/or people with disabilities, the Department has offered since 2006 a departmental teleassistance system 7 days a week, 24 hours a day, making it possible to combat isolation by providing assistance and comfort to the home, and improve the daily living conditions and safety of beneficiaries.<br> The technical implementation of this service (installation, maintenance and call management) has been entrusted to a private operator as part of a public service concession since 2021. The concessionaire ensures the operational, administrative and financial management of the system.<br> The Department has chosen to renew the public service concession contract at the end of December 31, 2026, for a period of 5 years.<br> The management of the public service will be carried out at the expense and risk of the concessionaire, which will be substantially remunerated from the marketing of services to users.<br> The concessionaire is expected to continue and develop the departmental remote assistance system in favor of an offer accessible to the greatest number of people, technically scalable but also guaranteeing reinforced social listening, particularly for the most vulnerable.<br> The management of this system involves:<br> Installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of Teleassistance equipment at subscribers' homes<br> Administrative and financial management of subscriptions<br> Call management in p.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GIP ATLANPOLE (44). Summary: Intellectual Services for Carrying out Experiments Based on the Use of Artificial Intelligence Technologies in Pays De La Loire (Edih Diva). Description: Framework agreement for subsequent contracts relating to the selection of 10 ESN service providers who will support Loire companies in carrying out experimental proofs based on Artificial Intelligence (POC IA DIVA) for a total amount of EUR 1,026,000 including tax. The maximum amount of each POC IA DIVA service is 38,000 EUR including tax.<br> The production of experimental proofs (POC IA DIVA) is the subject of an operation co-financed by the European Regional Development Fund (FEDER 21-27).<br> This framework agreement is multi-awarded in application of article R.2162-11 of the code of public procurement. The maximum number of beneficiaries of the Framework Agreement is limited to 10 (ten) service providers, subject to having received a sufficient number of offers which will be put back into competition pursuant to article R2162-10 of the CCP. It is executed by the conclusion of subsequent contracts in application of articles R.2162-2, R.2162-7 et seq. of the CCP.<br> LOT-0001<br> This consultation of this framework agreement for subsequent procurement concerns on the selection of service providers who will carry out experimental proof services (POC IA DIVA). The objective of AI POCs is to provide to companies in the Pays de la Loire Region, means of expertise to test AI solutions in experimental conditions before moving to an industrial scale.<br> Doc Title: Intellectual services for carrying out experiments based on the use of technologies d.... Published Date: 2025-11-20. Closing Date: 2025-12-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The forecast estimate of the framework agreement indicated in the indicative estimate details corresponds to approximately 400 rack-type servers to be supplied and maintained. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GRAND ANNECY. Summary: Acquisition, Implementation and Maintenance of Collection Tracking, Container Management and Professional Invoicing Software. Description: The purpose of the consultation is to define the functional and technical requirements relating to the implementation of business software divided into two batches. The first will be dedicated to the creation of tours and collection monitoring. A second batch will include the management and monitoring of containers, users and production locations, as well as invoicing of professionals. The solution chosen must make it easy to find a waste producer, to associate a certain number of containers with them, to allow invoicing afterwards. The aim of this approach is to review all of our business tools from a functional and interoperable point of view. The territory being very attractive, it is necessary to ensure a quality service around the staffing containers, monitoring and optimization of collection routes, but also invoicing management. In fact, a significant increase in the number of taxpayers is expected. The different solutions involved in this market must therefore be able to communicate with each other in order to facilitate the processing and crossing of data through robust flow exchanges. The acquisition of efficient and intuitive tools will contribute to optimizing the practices of service stakeholders and to improving overall management effectiveness Lot n°1 Collection tracking software See the CCTP for the description of the lot Lot n°2 Container management and invoicing software for professionals.... Published Date: 2025-11-19. Closing Date: 2025-12-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DALCIA (31). Summary: Framework Agreement for Subsequent Contracts for Project Management Missions in the Context of the Construction of Urban Heat Networks. Description: The subject of this consultation is one or more project management mission contracts as part of the design and execution of the work on all the works and equipment necessary for the construction of an urban heat network. on the perimeter of Toulouse Métropole. This consultation is a multi-awardee framework agreement with re-competition between three holders should the need arise. Each subsequent contract will be subject to a global and fixed price and may include optional installments and/or possible additional services. To date, the extension project covers 15 km of network. The project management of all or part of this work will be outsourced via this framework agreement, without this does not grant an exclusivity right. The maximum amount of the framework agreement is a legal limit and not an order commitment. The contracting entity reserves the right to ask tenderers to present one or more variants mandatory, which will then be described in the DCE. The services may be divided into firm installments and one or more optional installments. If applicable, the tranches will be described in the DCE offer phase. Framework agreement for subsequent contracts project management mission in the context of the construction of urban heat networks The sizing elements explained below are provisional, the final elements will be indicated.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: EDF SA. Summary: Framework Agreement for an Intellectual Services Market with a Variation of Agile Development Methods for is Projects. Description: The current MAD market was set up in June 2021, following the observation of the limits of the model previously applied: differentiation of BUILD contracts (AGILE development project phase) and RUN (TMA in V cycle for the MCO phase).<br> By applying the AGILE approach from end to end of the cycle life of applications, MAD has made it possible to respond reactively to the demands of the professions thanks to a sufficient number of Holders per area of ​​expertise, and to guarantee a good level of quality of developments by relying on recognized companies in each technological area.<br> For the future MAD2 market, and based on MAD feedback, the choice is made to strengthen the operational and contractual scope by:<br> -Focusing on the expertise of strategic technologies within the Business Units concerned: Web and Apps technologies, Microsoft developments SharePoint and .Net, EDM (Electronic Document Management), portals (LifeRay for Veol) and CRM;<br> -Adapting to the technical-economic challenges of the entire life cycle of applications and services: from project development (Build phase) to the resumption of operation of the solution produced (Run phase), making the reversibilities more fluid.<br> 6 lots are planned.<br> EDF SA issues this contract notice in its name and on behalf of its subsidiaries, direct beneficiary(ies) or beneficiaries of a stipulation clause for others.<br> The Subsidiaries will be able to benefit, if they wish and at their pre.... Published Date: 2025-11-18. Closing Date: 2025-12-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Framework Agreement for an Intellectual Services Market with a Variation of Agile Development Methods for is Projects

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SOLIDEO ALPES 2030. Summary: Project Management Assistance in Operational Management with Solideo Alpes 2030. Description: The purpose of the framework agreement is to provide project management assistance for operational management with Solideo Alpes 2030. It is concluded without a minimum amount and with a maximum annual amount, set in accordance with the provisions of article R.2162-4, 2 of the Public Procurement Code. The maximum annual amount of the framework agreement is 1,750,000 euro(s) excluding tax. The estimated value, indicated in this contract notice, covers the total duration of the framework agreement, renewals included. The services may take place at the Solideo Alpes 2030 headquarters, on other sites located in the territories that it determines, at the headquarters or in the premises of political governance bodies supporting Solideo Alpes 2030, at the headquarters and in the premises of project owners, as well as in the premises of the holder. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ENSUES LA REDONNE TOWN HALL. Summary: Management of the Information System of the Town of Ensues La Redonne. Description: The town of ENSUES LA REDONNE wishes to entrust the management of the information system to a service provider. The service must support the future IT challenges of the ENSUES LA REDONNE town hall in a process of progress plans and be able to respond to the development needs of organization and changes. The objectives of the service are to obtain quality service provision to users in terms of responsiveness, availability, traceability and visibility. The Service Provider must put in place the areas of progress necessary to this optimization in conjunction with the management of the ENSUES LA REDONNE town hall and the project manager. The ENSUES LA REDONNE town hall wishes to initiate a process of outsourcing its applications from 2027: messaging, office data via Share Point and its business software (mode SAAS). The removal of the existing VMWare 6.5 host server in order to update its information system as well as switch to a new hypervisor for AD Management and host certain VMs, is in progress. course.. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF VILLEURBANNE. Summary: Relaunch - Acquisition and Maintenance of Automation Equipment Based on Rfid Technology for the Management and Lending of Media Library Collections in the City of Villeurbanne. Description: estimated start date of the market The city of Villeurbanne provides its 162,000 inhabitants with a public reading network made up of two bookmobiles, an EACS service (artistic, cultural and scientific education) and three media libraries: the Maison du livre de l'image and sound, the Tonkin media library and the Rize media library. With 16,628 active users and 330,000 borrowable documents, all media (books, periodicals, CDs, DVDs, games, etc.), all of these establishments operate in a network under the Syracuse (Archimed) document management system and carry out approximately 1.7 million annual loan and return transactions. The project consists of the implementation, in the three media libraries, of an RFID self-service system for borrowing documents meeting the expectations and needs of the public and professionals. This consultation follows the initial consultation (reference: n2025_7886) which was declared without further action due to the need for the City to redefine its need. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-12-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: REGIE EAU D'AZUR (06). Summary: Acquisition, Deployment and Maintenance of Computer-Assisted Maintenance Management Software (Cmms) for the Production of Drinking Water and Sanitation.. Description: EAU d'AZUR wishes to implement a computer-assisted maintenance management tool (CMMS) with the aim of having visibility and efficient management of the maintenance of the operating fleet.<br> This tool must be hosted on the EAU d'AZUR servers and cover the following scope :<br> - drinking water works,<br> - sanitation works.<br> The main expected features are:<br> - Monitoring the costs of maintenance activity,<br> - Establishment of a renewal plan,<br> - Equipment management,<br> - Stakeholder management,<br> - Management and scheduling of interventions,<br> - Document management,<br> - Management of stock, supplies and purchases,<br> - Mass processing,<br> - Management of maintenance activity with reporting tool and dashboards,<br> - Mobility tool with QR code identification,<br> - Interfacing with supervision via the data warehouse,<br> - Interfacing with the GIS cartographic tool (ESRI),<br> - Interfacing with the FET application (HR timetable application, currently being replaced by ELAP's BURDIE software),<br> - Interfacing with control offices,<br> - Interfacing with the shared repository (meters, motorized valves, etc.).<br> Acquisition, deployment and maintenance of computer-assisted maintenance management software (CMMS) for the production of drinking water and sanitation.<br> EAU d'AZUR wishes to set up a computer-assisted maintenance management tool (CMMS) in the.... Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-12-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
